jobTitle: Business/Data Analyst for a Great Company
jobDescription: Our client is looking for a creative and motivated individual who has a passion for data, innovation, problem-solving, and continuous improvement. The ideal candidate will be a passionate problem-solver with excellent analytical skills, who is comfortable navigating large data sets from multiple sources, clearly connects technology solutions with measurable business value, and is eager to work fast and smart as part of a high-performing team. The Analyst will constantly seek ways to improve and automate day-to-day operations for the team, enabling us to exceed customer needs and expectations by delivering content quicker and with higher quality. The position is a great fit for a motivated self-starter who loves to drive sustainable solutions for real business problems.Primary Responsibilities:Lead or participate in multiple initiatives by evaluating business requirements managing project scope; determining priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of initiative tasks and milestones; and managing customer expectations on resultsIdentify, create and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis; focusing on quality improvement and data management; ensuring data is reliable and valid; developing process improvements; integrating new systems and processes with existing ones; and partnering with key stakeholders to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategiesProvide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders in CM; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunitiesSupport Content Management reporting needs by: gathering and documenting thorough requirements; identifying, preparing and analyzing data; creating ad hoc or persistent reports; and providing actionable insights to business users.Identifies new opportunities and solutions, and vets various methods and tools that could lead to future process improvements (in particular, with ways to automate manual processes and develop automation solutions)Provide leadership to team members and peers by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers and others; identifying and initiating projects; managing resources; driving the resolution of issues; and holding self and team accountable for resultsRole Based Competencies:•Analytical skills: Able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions from it. Exhibits probing mind and achieves penetrating insights. Requirements Analysis: Gathers, organizes and evaluates any information or data needed as input from stakeholders to determine requirements and specifications.Technical Proficiency: Understands complex components, technologies and architecture and thinks about the interdependencies and interconnected systems.Continuous Improvement: Continually focused on improving the responsiveness and quality of the solutions delivered.Creativity/innovation: Generates new and innovative approaches to problems.Efficiency: Able to produce significant output with minimal waste.Self-Motivated: ability to drive oneself to overcome challengesAgile Mentality: Places high value on service agility.Strategic Thinking: ability to think broadly about process and generate new ideas as well as drive the implementation of new workflows. Determines opportunities and threats through comprehensive analysis of current and future trends.Deadline-Driven: ability to meet goals and deadlines set by himself/herself and upper managementResults Driven: Focuses on desired results. Sets and achieves challenging goals.Persistent and Proactive: ability to dive into problem solving to identify true root cause and identify and communicate prevention plans.Accountability and Persistence: Holds self and other accountable for measurable high-quality, timely and cost effective results. Expects personal and team performance to be the best. • • • Determines objectives, sets priorities, and delegates work. Accepts responsibility for mistakes. Demonstrates tenacity and willingness to go the distance to get something done.Communication and Presentation: Able to effectively communicate and present technical concepts to technical and non-technical professionals.Openness to criticism and ideas: Often solicits feedback and reacts calmly to criticism or negative feedback.
